results.headline: Review: ‘Being Charlie,’ a Rehab Story Directed by Rob Reiner
results.summary_short: The director’s son Nick Reiner wrote the screenplay with Matt Elisofon, and it centers on a rebellious teenager whose father is a well-known entertainment figure.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Being Charlie

results.headline: Review: ‘The Offering’: No, Thank You
results.summary_short: Kelvin Tong’s horror movie tries to hit as many genre notes as possible, including spinning heads and pushy demons.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Offering

results.headline: Review: ‘Mad Tiger,’ or the Story of Peelander-Z’s Near Breakup
results.summary_short: This documentary follows a punk band as rifts form when one member quits and opens a bar.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mad Tiger

results.headline: Review: In ‘Captain America: Civil War,’ Super-Bro Against Super-Bro
results.summary_short: “Captain America: Civil War” does not in any way transcend the conventions of the genre. On the contrary: it succeeds because it doesn’t really try.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Captain America: Civil War

results.headline: Review: ‘A Bigger Splash,’ With a Speechless Tilda Swinton, Is Ready for Its Close-Up
results.summary_short: This film, filled with beautiful people, is a reluctant thriller about a rock star, her current lover, her former lover and a pretty young thing.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Bigger Splash

results.headline: Review: ‘Sin Alas’ Opens Up a Time Capsule in a Changing Havana
results.summary_short: This Ben Chace film, shot in Cuba before a recent diplomatic thaw, centers on a writer and a dancer from his past.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sin Alas

results.headline: Review: ‘Baaghi,’ a Bollywood Rebel Tale in Search of a Cause
results.summary_short: Fists and feet fly in this movie with the usual grab bag of romance, comedy and drama, directed by Sabbir Khan and starring Tiger Shroff and Shraddha Kapoor.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Baaghi

results.headline: Review: In ‘Older Than Ireland,’ Centenarians Recall Early and Latter Days
results.summary_short: Thirty wry old-timers are impressive raconteurs in this documentary directed by Alex Fegan, released during the centenary of the Easter Rising.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Older Than Ireland

results.headline: Review: In ‘Viva,’ a Star Is Waiting to Be Born
results.summary_short: A macho father released from prison decides to move in with the son he abandoned, who is a sweet-natured gay hairdresser and an aspiring drag queen.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Viva

results.headline: Review: Kidman and Bateman Face Childhood Scars in ‘The Family Fang’
results.summary_short: In this adaptation of Kevin Wilson’s novel, siblings grapple with memories of an upbringing spent being used as artistic props by their parents.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Family Fang

results.headline: Review: ‘L’Attesa’ (‘The Wait’) Turns Life Into a Ghost Story
results.summary_short: Juliette Binoche stars as the mother of a young man who has just been killed, and Lou de Laâge plays his girlfriend, who doesn’t know.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of L’Attesa (The Wait)

results.headline: Review: ‘The Man Who Knew Infinity’ Gives a Mathematical Genius His Due
results.summary_short: This film centers on Srinivasa Ramanujan, a brilliant mathematician from India, and his unlikely friendship with the Cambridge professor G.H. Hardy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Man Who Knew Infinity

results.headline: Review: ‘A Beautiful Planet’ Shows a Dazzling Earth From Space
results.summary_short: Images of the planet, and even mundane tasks, take on a fascinating quality in this documentary shot by astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Beautiful Planet

results.headline: Review: ‘The American Side,’ a Hard-Boiled Noir Set in Buffalo
results.summary_short: A private investigator, a murdered stripper, a mystery and a reverent throwback to the spirit of Mickey Spillane.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The American Side

results.headline: Review: ‘Bourek,’ About a Group of Drifting Souls
results.summary_short: Assorted characters on an island bicker and lounge against a backdrop of news reports heralding social and financial catastrophe.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bourek

results.headline: Review: ‘Dough,’ a Sweet but Pat Tale of Bridging Religious and Racial Differences
results.summary_short: Jonathan Pryce and Jerome Holder star in this feature about an elderly Jewish baker in London who ends up hiring a young black Muslim as his assistant.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dough

results.headline: Review: ‘Mother’s Day’ Is a Goopy, Glossy Sentimental Mess
results.summary_short: Jennifer Aniston, Kate Hudson and Julia Roberts star in this holiday-themed film that generates inadvertent laughs and has predictable plotlines.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mother’s Day

results.headline: Review: ‘Papa: Hemingway in Cuba,’ a Mild Voyage With the Old Man and ‘the Kid’
results.summary_short: In Bob Yari’s autobiographical film, a young Miami journalist’s fan letter leads to a fishing trip and a long friendship with his literary hero.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Papa: Hemingway in Cuba

results.headline: Review: ‘Pali Road’ Blends Romance and Suspense
results.summary_short: Although the acting can be wooden at times, ‘Pali Road’ is a decent film set in a gorgeous locale.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pali Road

results.headline: Review: ‘Ratchet & Clank,’ a Stale Tale Based on a PlayStation Game
results.summary_short: The movie has little story to tell and few ideas to offer, but a great deal of product to sell.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ratchet & Clank
